column3: Welcome to Tuliyollal! You're the, ah...<Emphasis>adventurer</Emphasis> Wuk Lamat recruited to her entourage, yes? If there's anything you wish to know, I am at your service.
What manner of place is this?
Is it not obvious at a glance? Then again, perhaps an Eorzean would be unfamiliar with Mamool Ja culture... I am of the Boonewa tribe, and like most of my kin, I specialize in matters of the arcane.
As soon as I came of age, I left my hometown of Mamook and journeyed all across Tural to hone my skills. It gave me some much-needed perspective on the world around me.
I considered traveling to Eorzea next, but I took quite a liking to Tuliyollal, and so I plan to remain to make use of my magicks here.
Tuliyollal is the beating heart of Tural that the Dawnservant would call home.
It got its start about eighty years ago, when the newly crowned Dawnservant decided to build a town centered on the Yok Huy temple ruins.
By implementing a medley of techniques from all different Turali cultures, the Tuliyollal style of architecture was born! Beautiful, isn't it?

By the way, have you heard that Gulool Ja Ja is stepping down as Dawnservant? I suppose he just wants to live out his final years in peace. In any case, I hope you're excited for the ascension ceremony─it ought to be quite the spectacle!
More importantly, did you attend the ascension ceremony? As a proud citizen of Tuliyollal, I couldn't be happier to have Koana and Wuk Lamat as our new Vows of Reason and Resolve!
Now if only there was something we could do about those disgusting metal monsters. The audacity of them to trample all over our proud history!
It was that same unity across all cultures that brought us together to protect it. I've never been prouder to call Tuliyollal home!

And when Wuk Lamat returned home victorious, the myriad communities of Tuliyollal were right here to welcome her. Whatever problems are still ahead of us, I know we'll be in good hands─hers <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> Koana's!
